snippet: The university rebutted Exxon’s accusation that articles about the oil company, produced by journalists from the school, were misleading and inaccurate.
abstract: Columbia Graduate School of Journalism Dean Steve Coll publicly disputes allegations by Exxon Mobil that two investigative articles published in Los Angeles Times, written by journalists from school, were inaccurate and deliberately misleading about disparity between company's public position on climate change and its internal knowledge of issue; dispute highlights possibility that, on both sides of public policy debates, manner in which expensive accountability reporting is funded can create perceptions of bias.
lead_paragraph: The university rebutted Exxon’s accusation that articles about the oil company, produced by journalists from the school, were misleading and inaccurate.

headline.main: Columbia Disputes Exxon Mobil on Climate Risk Articles
headline.print_headline: Columbia Disputes Exxon on Climate Risk Articles
